alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:28PM CDT until May 11 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN TENSAS PARISH...SOUTHERN CLAIBORNE AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 128 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Port Gibson to near Alcorn State to near Waterproof, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Pattison around 140 PM CDT. Lorman around 145 PM CDT. Red Lick around 155 PM CDT. Fayette around 210 PM CDT. Peyton around 215 PM CDT. Blue Hill around 235 PM CDT. Mcbride and Union Church around 245 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
